title: Dizzy Gillespie - Have Trumpet, Will Excite! (1959) [EAC-FLAC]
description:
Dizzy Gillespie - Have Trumpet, Will Excite! (1959)
            EAC rip (secure mode) | FLAC (tracks)+CUE+LOG -> 453 Mb 
                    Full Artwork @ 300 dpi (png) -> 56 Mb


This collection contains the complete Dizzy Gillespie studio LP "Have Trumpet, Will Excite!" (Verve MGV S-8313), made by the outstanding 1959 Gillespie Quintet with Junior Mance and Les Spann. Two additional tunes and the only existing four alternate takes from the sessions have been added here as a bonus.

It's easy and perhaps unfair to take any later jazz album by a trendy, "hot" trumpeter and compare it to a classic like Have Trumpet, Will Excite!. Critics and fans have been afforded the luxury of time to weed out half-efforts. Still, even without former knowledge of who Dizzy Gillespie is, Have Trumpet, Will Excite! separates itself from the crowd pretty quickly. 

The Latin up-tempo arrangement of "My Heart Belongs to Daddy" thrusts the song into an entirely different realm. Junior Mance's piano kicks things of with a quirky, forceful rhythm, and after Gillespie's trumpet lays down the bare bones of the melody, it's pretty much forgotten. From there, the band takes off on a creative surge. The same is true of "My Man." A brave arrangement, kicked off by piano and outlined by trumpet, completely rewrites the piece. "Sure," Gillespie and the band, seem to say, "We can play old swing tunes, but wouldn't it be cool if we turned them inside out?" This approach, along with sharp solos, gives the material an exciting edge. 

Gillespie's solo on "St. Louis Blues" just soars, while Les Spann, who plays both flute and guitar on the album, follows him with a bristly guitar solo. Mance offers distinctive piano work that matches Gillespie's enthusiasm on tunes like "Woody 'N' You," while bassist Sam Jones and drummer Lex Humphries keep a high-octane rhythm in constant motion. Have Trumpet, Will Excite! more than measures up to its promise and stands as a cornerstone of Gillespie's '50s work.


Recorded in New York, February 17-20, 1959.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tracklist:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------

01 - My Heart Belongs To Daddy
02 - My Man
03 - Moonglow
04 - ST. Louis Blues
05 - Woody' N You
06 - Wrap Your Troubles In Dreams
07 - There Is No Greater Love
08 - I Found A Million Dollar Baby (In The Five And Ten Cent Store)
09 - Squatty Rod
10 - OO - Shoo - Be - Doo - Be
11 - There Is No Greater Love [Alt Tk 1]
12 - There Is No Greater Love [Alt Tk 2]
13 - There Is No Greater Love [Alt Tk 3]
14 - I Found A Million Dollar Baby (In The Five And Ten Cent Store) [Alt Tk]

*2015 Verve / Poll Winners Records | PWR 27343 | 24-bit remaster {2015 Poll Winners 24-bit Remaster}


Personnel:
Dizzy Gillespie - trumpet & vocals
Junior Mance - piano
Lex Humphries - drums
Sam Jones - bass
Les Spann - guitar & flute
Francisco "Chino" Pozo - congas
Johnny Hodges - alto sax



Enjoy and Sharing, Thanks!
